title: Sri Lanka rupee at 330/345 to TT dollar
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 330/345 for telegraphic transfers on April 25, rising from the previous week, while the interbank spot was mostly inactive, market participants said.
The central bank’s indicative spot was quoted at 334.8 rupees against the US dollar on Monday.

At the time of filing, central bank had not issued the telegraphic transfer rates for Monday. On Friday, the telegraphic transfer rate was 327.5/339.99 against the US dollar, remaining the same as Thursday.
In secondary markets, it was completely inactive ahead of the weekly bills auction and a bond auction Friday, market participants said.
Dealers said there were no active quotes for bond or bill maturities.
Sri Lanka’s debt office is issuing 87.5 billion rupees to be sold n an auction held today.
